hero.headline: Anthropic Donates MCP to New Agentic AI Foundation, OpenAI Co-Founds with AGENTS.md Standard
hero.summary: In a landmark move for AI interoperability, Anthropic has donated the Model Context Protocol to the newly established Agentic AI Foundation, co-founded with OpenAI who contributed AGENTS.md—a simple, open format for guiding coding agents. The foundation aims to create universal standards for how AI agents interact with tools, codebases, and each other.
hero.whyItMatters: This signals a fundamental shift from proprietary AI walled gardens to collaborative infrastructure. With both Anthropic and OpenAI contributing their agent communication standards to a neutral foundation, developers can build agents that work across platforms. The 'agent protocol wars' may be ending before they truly began—and everyone building AI tools wins.

topStories.title: Accenture to Train 30,000 Professionals on Claude—Anthropic's Largest Enterprise Deployment
topStories.summary: Accenture and Anthropic announced a major expansion forming the Accenture Anthropic Business Group with approximately 30,000 professionals receiving Claude training. CEO Dario Amodei called it Anthropic's largest real-world Claude Code deployment to date, signaling enterprise AI adoption is accelerating.

topStories.title: Mistral Releases Devstral 2 and Vibe CLI with 72.2% SWE-Bench Score
topStories.summary: Mistral announced Devstral 2 achieving 72.2% on SWE-Bench Verified—making it highly competitive with Claude and GPT models on coding benchmarks. The release includes Vibe CLI, a new conversational coding tool that challenges established players.

topStories.title: The Death and Rebirth of Prompt Engineering: From Hot Job to Expected Skill
topStories.summary: Two years after being proclaimed the 'hot new job in tech,' prompt engineering as a standalone role has all but disappeared. Strong AI prompting is now simply an expected skill, not a career. But the byLLM framework shows the future: automatic context-aware prompts that make manual engineering obsolete.

topStories.title: Launch HN: Mentat Introduces Runtime Intervention for LLM Control
topStories.summary: YC-backed startup Mentat launched with a novel approach to LLM safety: runtime intervention mechanisms that allow programmatic control during inference. Rather than relying solely on training or prompting, Mentat enables guardrails that activate mid-generation.

trendingRepos.name: thedotmack/claude-mem
trendingRepos.description: Claude Code plugin that automatically captures session activity, compresses it with AI using Claude's agent-sdk, and injects relevant context back into future sessions. Persistent memory for agentic workflows.

trendingRepos.name: agentsmd/agents.md
trendingRepos.description: AGENTS.md—a simple, open format for guiding coding agents. Donated to the Agentic AI Foundation as the standard way to instruct AI agents about repository conventions and constraints.

trendingRepos.name: block/goose
trendingRepos.description: An open source, extensible AI agent that goes beyond code suggestions—install, execute, edit, and test with any LLM. Rust-based for performance with support for multiple model providers.

trendingRepos.name: dyad-sh/dyad
trendingRepos.description: Free, local, open-source AI app builder—a v0/lovable/Bolt alternative. Build full applications with AI assistance without sending code to external services.

trendingSkills.name: activitypub-federation
trendingSkills.description: ActivityPub protocol specification and federation mechanics understanding for WordPress development. Part of Automattic's official Claude Code skills for fediverse integration.

trendingSkills.name: zellij-config
trendingSkills.description: Zellij terminal multiplexer configuration including layouts, themes, and keybindings. Perfect for developers customizing their terminal workspace with AI assistance.

trendingSkills.name: rust-architect
trendingSkills.description: Designs Rust applications with async patterns, domain models, and workspace structures. Guides architectural decisions for production Rust codebases.

trendingSkills.name: claude-code-memory
trendingSkills.description: Audits and organizes .claude/memory/ files to reduce context pollution. Helps maintain clean, relevant memory state for long-running Claude Code sessions.

newMcpServers.name: kubectl-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: MCP Server enabling AI assistants to interact with Kubernetes clusters via kubectl operations. Manage pods, deployments, and services directly from Claude Code.

newMcpServers.name: playwright-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Playwright Model Context Protocol Server for browser and API automation in Claude Desktop, Cline, Cursor IDE and more. End-to-end testing and web scraping with AI.

newMcpServers.name: gmail-mcp
newMcpServers.description: Model Context Protocol server for Gmail operations using IMAP/SMTP with app password authentication. List, search, and send emails through AI agents.

newMcpServers.name: mcp-code-interpreter
newMcpServers.description: Python execution tool mimicking Jupyter notebook environment. Accepts code snippets, executes them, and maintains state across sessions—ideal for iterative development.

notableHooks.name: Auto-Format on File Edit
notableHooks.description: Automatically runs Prettier on TypeScript/JavaScript files after Claude edits them. Matches Edit|Write tools and uses jq to extract file_path, then formats if it's a .ts or .js file.

notableHooks.name: Desktop Notification on Completion
notableHooks.description: Sends a desktop notification when Claude finishes a task. Perfect for long-running operations where you've switched contexts—get alerted when Claude needs your attention.

notableHooks.name: GitButler Auto-Commit Integration
notableHooks.description: GitButler's hook system automatically manages commits after file changes. Matches Edit|MultiEdit|Write patterns to track changes, with a Stop hook ensuring all work is committed.

tuiTools.name: yazi
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal file manager written in Rust with async I/O. Features image previews, bulk operations, and vim-like keybindings. The modern alternative to ranger.

tuiTools.name: posting
tuiTools.description: A powerful HTTP client that lives in your terminal. Beautiful interface built with Textual for testing APIs without leaving the command line.

tuiTools.name: rainfrog
tuiTools.description: Database management TUI for Postgres, MySQL, and SQLite. Query, browse, and manage databases with a beautiful ratatui-powered interface.

tuiTools.name: k9s
tuiTools.description: Kubernetes CLI to manage your clusters in style. Navigate resources, view logs, and execute commands with vim-like efficiency. The definitive K8s TUI.

trendingVideos.title: Stop Switching Between Cursor and JetBrains - AI Coding Native in IDEA
How I code with AI right now
7 Antigravity Features That Give Vibe Coders An UNFAIR Advantage
7 Secret Nano Banana Pro Prompts That Nobody Shares

highlights: Named session support: use /rename to name sessions, /resume <name> to resume them
Agents and bash commands can run asynchronously with wake-up messaging to main agent
New /stats command provides usage statistics including favorite model and usage streak
JIT context manager with configurable settings for smarter context handling
Built-in holiday theme for festive terminal vibes
MCP server instructions support and dynamic tool updates via notifications
Execpolicy improvements: TUI whitelists command prefixes after approval, sandbox denials propose amendments
Cloud exec now accepts --branch for remote runs with status/diff/apply flows
Codex Max is now the default model in the CLI

notableQuotes.quote: We believe that open, interoperable standards are essential for the responsible development of AI agents. By donating MCP to the Agentic AI Foundation, we're ensuring these standards remain community-driven rather than controlled by any single company.
notableQuotes.author: Anthropic

notableQuotes.quote: Two years ago, everybody said 'Oh, I think Prompt Engineer is going to be the hot job.' But you don't have to have the perfect prompt anymore. Today, strong AI prompting is simply an expected skill, not a stand-alone role.
notableQuotes.author: Jared Spataro
notableQuotes.role: Chief Marketing Officer of AI at Work, Microsoft

notableQuotes.quote: This partnership represents Anthropic's largest real-world deployment of Claude Code to date, with approximately 30,000 professionals receiving specialized training on building with Claude.
notableQuotes.author: Dario Amodei

prompt: Daily AI news digest for December 10, 2025. Hero: Anthropic donates MCP to new Agentic AI Foundation, co-founded with OpenAI contributing AGENTS.md—a landmark moment for AI interoperability standards. Top stories: Accenture's 30,000-person Claude training (largest enterprise deployment), Mistral's Devstral 2 achieving 72.2% SWE-Bench, prompt engineering's evolution from hot job to expected skill, Mentat's runtime intervention launch. Fresh trending repos: claude-mem (session memory plugin), agents.md (OpenAI's agent standard), block/goose (Rust AI agent), dyad (local AI app builder). New skills from SkillsMP: ActivityPub federation, Zellij config, Rust architect, Claude memory management. MCP servers: kubectl, playwright, gmail, code-interpreter. Notable hooks: PostToolUse auto-format, Stop desktop notifications, GitButler integration. TUI tools: yazi, posting, rainfrog, k9s. All tool changelogs updated to latest versions (Claude Code 2.0.64, Gemini CLI 0.20.0, Codex 0.66.0).
